skill.name: clojure-review
skill.description: Review Clojure and ClojureScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing Clojure/ClojureScript code.
skill.summary: Review Clojure and ClojureScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only review guidance and checklists. No file access, network calls, or execution logic is present. No security threats detected.

content.user_title: Review Clojure diffs for Metabase style
content.value_statement: Clojure reviews can miss Metabase specific rules and naming conventions. This skill provides a focused checklist and feedback patterns to catch issues.
actual_capabilities: Checks naming, docstring, and organization rules from the Metabase Clojure style guide
Flags REST API, MBQL, database, and driver convention issues
Uses a quick review checklist to scan common problems
Applies a pattern table to spot frequent style violations
Provides example feedback wording for review comments
limitations: Does not run code, tests, or linters
Requires the user to provide diffs or code context
Skips missing parenthesis issues by design
Focuses on Metabase standards, not general Clojure lint rules

use_cases.title: Review PRs faster
use_cases.description: Use a focused checklist to flag Metabase specific Clojure issues in pull requests.

use_cases.title: Pre review check
use_cases.description: Self review changes before submitting to avoid common style violations.

use_cases.title: Consistency guard
use_cases.description: Ensure module, API, and naming conventions stay consistent across the codebase.

prompt_templates.title: Basic style scan
prompt_templates.scenario: Small diff in a Clojure file
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this diff for Metabase Clojure style violations and list only issues that need fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Naming and docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Check naming, docstrings, and visibility for these changes. Flag any violations only.

prompt_templates.title: API and MBQL review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this API change for REST, schema, and MBQL conventions. Provide only issues.

prompt_templates.title: Full checklist pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the full Metabase Clojure review checklist to this diff and list the problems found.

output_examples.input: Review this diff for Metabase Clojure style issues
output: Public function lacks a docstring explaining purpose and inputs.
Side effect function name is missing a trailing exclamation mark.
Query parameter uses snake_case; use kebab-case.

best_practices: Provide focused diffs and note affected modules
Ask for specific checklist sections when needed
Verify public API and tests for new endpoints
anti_patterns: Asking for linting of missing parentheses
Using it without sharing any code changes

faq.question: Is it compatible with ClojureScript?
faq.answer: Yes. It reviews Clojure and ClojureScript diffs using Metabase rules.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It does not run code or tests and only reviews what you provide.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI tools?
faq.answer: It provides review guidance, not automated CI integration.

faq.question: Does it access my files or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It only analyzes the content you share in the prompt.

faq.question: What if it misses an issue?
faq.answer: Provide more context or ask for a focused checklist pass.

faq.question: How is it different from a linter?
faq.answer: It applies Metabase specific review rules and feedback guidance.
